"Citations is a software created by Luigi Tiburzi and Gabriele Lanaro, with the collaboration of Francesco Pochetti.\nOur aim is to always give you the most needed thought in a splendid fashion"

"All love shifts and changes. I don't know if you can be wholeheartedly in love all the time - J. Andrews"
"You never lose by loving. You always lose by holding back - B. de Angelis"
"I love that feeling of being in love, the effect of having butterflies when you wake up in the morning. That is special - J. Aniston"
"Love takes up where knowledge leaves off - T. Aquinas"
"Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies - Aristotle"
"Lord, grant that I might not so much seek to be loved as to love - Francis of Assisi"
"Love is the beauty of the soul - S. Augustine"
"Can miles truly separate you from friends? If you want to be with someone you love, aren't you already there? - R. Bach"
"Love does not begin and end the way we seem to think it does. Love is a battle, love is a war; love is a growing up - J. A. Baldwin"
"Love takes off masks that we fear we cannot live without and know we cannot live within - J. A. Baldwin"
"Love yourself first and everything else falls into line. You really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world - L. Ball"
"A woman knows the face of the man she loves as a sailor knows the open sea - H. d. Balzac"
"The more one judges, the less one loves - H. d. Balzac"
"When love is not madness, it is not love - P. C. d. l. Barca"
"Love is the hardest habit to break, and the most difficult to satisfy - D. Barrymore"
"A kiss is a rosy dot over the 'i' of loving - C. d. Bergerac"
"A kiss is a lovely trick designed by nature to stop speech when words become superfluous - I. Bergman"
"Your words are my food, your breath my wine. You are everything to me - S. Bernhardt"
"All my life, my heart has yearned for a thing I cannot name - A. Breton"
"Love is when you meet someone who tells you something new about yourself - A. Breton"
"Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same - E. Bronte"
"The best proof of love is trust - J. Brothers"
"The sweetest of all sounds is that of the voice of the woman we love - J. d. l. Bruyere"
"If you wish to be loved, show more of your faults than your virtues - E. G. B. Lytton"
"Love is always bestowed as a gift freely, willingly and without expectation. We don't love to be loved; we love to love - L. Buscaglia"
"Love is life. And if you miss love, you miss life - L. Buscaglia"
"Don't brood. Get on with living and loving. You don't have forever - L. Buscaglia"
"What love we've given, we'll have forever. What love we fail to give, will be lost for all eternity - L. Buscaglia"
"Absence, that common cure of love - L. Byron"
"Love is a friendship set to music - J. Campbell"
"Love means to commit yourself without guarantee - A. Campbell"
"A loving heart is the beginning of all knowledge - T. Carlyle"
"The way to love anything is to realize that it may be lost - G. K. Chesterton"
"Love means to love that which is unlovable; or it is no virtue at all - G. K. Chesterton"
"A new command I give you: Love one another. As I have loved you, so you must love one another - J. Christ"
"As the Father has loved me, so have I loved you - J. Christ"
"One is loved because one is loved. No reason is needed for loving - P. Coelho"
"The degree of loving is measured by the degree of giving - E. L. Cole"
"Friendship often ends in love; but love in friendship, never - C. C. Colton"
"Only do what your heart tells you - P. Diana"
"A loving heart is the truest wisdom - C. Dickens"
"Gravitation is not responsible for people falling in love - A. Einstein"
"Love is a better teacher than duty - A. Einstein"
"I like not only to be loved, but also to be told I am loved - G. Eliot"
"Blessed is the influence of one true, loving human soul on another - G. Eliot"
"Love is supreme and unconditional; like is nice but limited - D. Ellington"
"The art of love is largely the art of persistence - A. Ellis"
"All mankind love a lover - R. W. Emerson"
"Love is all we have, the only way that each can help the other - Euripides"
"He is not a lover who does not love forever - Euripides"
"The most powerful weapon on earth is the human soul on fire - F. Foch"
"Bitterness imprisons life; love releases it - H. E. Fosdick"
"A man is already halfway in love with any woman who listens to him - B. Francis"
"If you would be loved, love, and be loveable - B. Franklin"
"Immature love says: 'I love you because I need you.' Mature love says 'I need you because I love you.' - E. Fromm"
"Love is the only sane and satisfactory answer to the problem of human existence - E. Fromm"
"In love the paradox occurs that two beings become one and yet remain two - E. Fromm"
"Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired - R. Frost"
"Love is a game that two can play and both win - E. Gabor"
"Love has no age, no limit; and no death - J. Galsworthy"
"Where there is love there is life - M. Gandhi"
"I can live without money, but I cannot live without love - J. Garland"
"Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit - K. Gibran"
"Love possesses not nor will it be possessed, for love is sufficient unto love - K. Gibran"
"Love it surrounds every being and extends slowly to embrace all that shall be - K. Gibran"
"Love does not dominate; it cultivates - J. W. v. Goethe"
"To witness two lovers is a spectacle for the gods - J. W. v. Goethe"
"The way to know life is to love many things - V. V. Gogh"
"I was born with an enormous need for affection, and a terrible need to give it - A. Hepburn"
"The best thing to hold onto in life is each other - A. Hepburn"
"The love we give away is the only love we keep - E. Hubbard"
"The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved; loved for ourselves, or rather, loved in spite of ourselves - V. Hugo"
"To love another person is to see the face of God - V. Hugo"
"Life is the flower for which love is the honey - V. Hugo"
"Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place - Z. N. Hurston"
"Love can sometimes be magic. But magic can sometimes just be an illusion - Javan"
"Love doesn't make the world go 'round. Love is what makes the ride worthwhile - F. P. Jones"
"A part of kindness consists in loving people more than they deserve - J. Joubert"
"I have decided to stick with love. Hate is too great a burden to bear - M. L. K. Jr."
"Love is when the other person's happiness is more important than your own - H. J. B. Jr."
"Sometimes the heart sees what is invisible to the eye - H. J. B. Jr."
"Love is my religion, I could die for it - J. Keats"
"What we have once enjoyed we can never lose. All that we love deeply becomes a part of us - H. Keller"
"People think love is an emotion. Love is good sense - K. Kesey"
"There is a woman at the beginning of all great things - A. d. Lamartine"
"No mortal tongue could speak, the feelings in my breast - G. Leopardi"
"Love is the flower you've got to let grow - J. Lennon"
"Everything is clearer when you're in love - J. Lennon"
"Affection is responsible for nine tenths of whatever solid and durable happiness there is in our lives - C. S. Lewis"
"It is difficult to know at what moment love begins; it is less difficult to know that it has begun - H. W. Longfellow"
"Come live in my heart, and pay no rent - S. Lover"
"It's useless to hold a person to anything he says while he's in love, drunk, or running for office - S. MacLaine"
"Do all things with love - O. Mandino"
"Love is like war: easy to begin but very hard to stop - H. L. Mencken"
"Love is the triumph of imagination over intelligence - H. L. Mencken"
"Love is the illusion that one woman differs from another - H. L. Mencken"
"Love cures people, both the ones who give it and the ones who receive it - K. A. Menninger"
"The one thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give enough is love - H. Miller"
"Choose your love, Love your choice - T. S. Monson"
"Faith makes all things possible love makes all things easy - D. L. Moody"
"A flower cannot blossom without sunshine, and man cannot live without love - M. Muller"
"We can only learn to love by loving - I. Murdoch"
"Love is an emotion experienced by the many and enjoyed by the few - G. J. Nathan"
"We love life, not because we are used to living but because we are used to loving - F. Nietzsche"
"A pair of powerful spectacles has sometimes sufficed to cure a person in love - F. Nietzsche"
"The only abnormality is the incapacity to love - A. Nin"
"If you want to be loved, be lovable - Ovid"
"Love knows not distance; it hath no continent; its eyes are for the stars - G. Parker"
"When we are in love we seem to ourselves quite different from what we were before - B. Pascal"
"Love is the greatest refreshment in life - P. Picasso"
"At the touch of love everyone becomes a poet - Plato"
"Love is the joy of the good, the wonder of the wise, the amazement of the Gods - Plato"
"We loved with a love that was more than love - E. A. Poe"
"How absurd and delicious it is to be in love with somebody younger than yourself. Everybody should try it - B. Pym"
"Gestures, in love, are incomparably more attractive, effective and valuable than words - F. Rabelais"
"To say 'I love you' one must first be able to say the 'I' - A. Rand"
"Love consists in this, that two solitudes protect and touch and greet each other - R. M. Rilke"
"We waste time looking for the perfect lover, instead of creating the perfect love - T. Robbins"
"Absence diminishes mediocre passions and increases great ones, as the wind extinguishes candles and fans fires - F. d. L. Rochefoucauld"
"True love is like ghosts, which everyone talks about and few have seen - F. d. L. Rochefoucauld"
"There is no disguise which can hide love for long where it exists, or simulate it where it does not - F. d. L. Rochefoucauld"
"There is only one kind of love, but there are a thousand imitations - F. d. L. Rochefoucauld"
"The giving of love is an education in itself - E. Roosevelt"
"Falling in love consists merely in uncorking the imagination and bottling the common sense - H. Rowland"
"Before I met my husband, I'd never fallen in love. I'd stepped in it a few times - R. Rudner"
"To fear love is to fear life, and those who fear life are already three parts dead - B. Russell"
"For small creatures such as we the vastness is bearable only through love - C. Sagan"
"We need 4 hugs a day for survival. We need 8 hugs a day for maintenance. We need 12 hugs a day for growth - V. Satir"
"True love comes quietly, without banners or flashing lights. If you hear bells, get your ears checked - E. Segal"
"If you wished to be loved, love - L. A. Seneca"
"Love in its essence is spiritual fire - L. A. Seneca"
"As soon go kindle fire with snow, as seek to quench the fire of love with words - W. Shakespeare"
"Love is a smoke made with the fume of sighs - W. Shakespeare"
"First love is only a little foolishness and a lot of curiosity - G. B. Shaw"
"Love is a gross exaggeration of the difference between one person and everybody else - G. B. Shaw"
"Love is but the discovery of ourselves in others, and the delight in the recognition - A. Smith"
"A very small degree of hope is sufficient to cause the birth of love - Stendhal"
"You can give without loving, but you can never love without giving - R. L. Stevenson"
"Love is the only reality and it is not a mere sentiment. It is the ultimate truth that lies at the heart of creation - R. Tagore"
"It is better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all - A. L. Tennyson"
"I have found the paradox, that if you love until it hurts, there can be no more hurt, only more love - M. Teresa"
"Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love - M. Teresa"
"Love begins at home, and it is not how much we do but how much love we put in that action - M. Teresa"
"The hunger for love is much more difficult to remove than the hunger for bread - M. Teresa"
"There is no remedy for love but to love more - H. D. Thoreau"
"The first duty of love is to listen - P. Tillich"
"Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage - L. Tzu"
"Love is of all passions the strongest, for it attacks simultaneously the head, the heart and the senses - L. Tzu"
"It is sad not to love, but it is much sadder not to be able to love - M. d. Unamuno"
"Love is an act of endless forgiveness, a tender look which becomes a habit - P. Ustinov"
"Love is being stupid together - P. Valery"
"Love is a canvas furnished by nature and embroidered by imagination - Voltaire"
"Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead - O. Wilde"
"To love oneself is the beginning of a lifelong romance - O. Wilde"
"Who, being loved, is poor? - O. Wilde"
"Love isn't something you find. Love is something that finds you - L. Young"
"Do not worry about avoiding temptation. As you grow older it will avoid you - J. Adams"
"I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by - D. Adams"
"I like long walks, especially when they are taken by people who annoy me - F. Allen"
"I am not afraid of death, I just don't want to be there when it happens - W. Allen"
"My one regret in life is that I am not someone else - W. Allen"
"People who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do - I. Asimov"
"We are all here on earth to help others; what on earth the others are here for I don't know - W. H. Auden"
"O Lord, help me to be pure, but not yet - S. Augustine"
"You see much more of your children once they leave home - L. Ball"
"If I had to live my life again, I'd make the same mistakes, only sooner - T. Bankhead"
"It is a scientific fact that your body will not absorb cholesterol if you take it from another person's plate - D. Barry"
"I have tried to know absolutely nothing about a great many things, and I have succeeded fairly well - R. Benchley"
"You can lead a man to Congress, but you can't make him think - M. Berle"
"A committee is a group that keeps minutes and loses hours - M. Berle"
"A nickel ain't worth a dime anymore - Y. Berra"
"I never said most of the things I said - Y. Berra"
"There are lots of people who mistake their imagination for their memory - J. Billings"
"A friend doesn't go on a diet because you are fat - E. Bombeck"
"Guilt: the gift that keeps on giving - E. Bombeck"
"Never have more children than you have car windows - E. Bombeck"
"A vegetarian is a person who won't eat anything that can have children - D. Brenner"
"Tragedy is when I cut my finger. Comedy is when you fall into an open sewer and die - M. Brooks"
"I buy expensive suits. They just look cheap on me - W. Buffett"
"Age is something that doesn't matter, unless you are a cheese - L. Bunuel"
"Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close knit family in another city - G. Burns"
"Weather forecast for tonight: dark - G. Carlin"
"Frisbeetarianism is the belief that when you die, your soul goes up on the roof and gets stuck - G. Carlin"
"Electricity is really just organized lightning - G. Carlin"
"In comic strips, the person on the left always speaks first - G. Carlin"
"Behind every great man is a woman rolling her eyes - J. Carrey"
"I'm undaunted in my quest to amuse myself by constantly changing my hair - H. Clinton"
"My definition of an intellectual is someone who can listen to the William Tell Overture without thinking of the Lone Ranger - B. Connolly"
"I have never been hurt by what I have not said - C. Coolidge"
"A word to the wise ain't necessary, it's the stupid ones that need the advice - B. Cosby"
"Always end the name of your child with a vowel, so that when you yell the name will carry - B. Cosby"
"Fatherhood is pretending the present you love most is soap on a rope - B. Cosby"
"I found there was only one way to look thin: hang out with fat people - R. Dangerfield"
"I haven't spoken to my wife in years. I didn't want to interrupt her - R. Dangerfield"
"I looked up my family tree and found out I was the sap - R. Dangerfield"
"By all means let's be open minded, but not so open minded that our brains drop out - R. Dawkins"
"Housework can't kill you, but why take a chance? - P. Diller"
"Best way to get rid of kitchen odors: Eat out - P. Diller"
"The only time I ever enjoyed ironing was the day I accidentally got gin in the steam iron - P. Diller"
"I love Mickey Mouse more than any woman I have ever known - W. Disney"
"They say marriages are made in Heaven. But so is thunder and lightning - C. Eastwood"
"If the facts don't fit the theory, change the facts - A. Einstein"
"I cook with wine, sometimes I even add it to the food - W. C. Fields"
"I never drink water because of the disgusting things that fish do in it - W. C. Fields"
"I like children, fried - W. C. Fields"
"Wine is constant proof that God loves us and loves to see us happy - B. Franklin"
"I don't need you to remind me of my age. I have a bladder to do that for me - S. Fry"
"He taught me housekeeping; when I divorce I keep the house - Z. Z. Gabor"
"Food, love, career, and mothers, the four major guilt groups - C. Guisewite"
"As a child my family's menu consisted of two choices: take it or leave it - B. Hackett"
"My fake plants died because I did not pretend to water them - M. Hedberg"
"A waffle is like a pancake with a syrup trap - M. Hedberg"
"I drank some boiling water because I wanted to whistle - M. Hedberg"
"I wear a necklace, cause I want to know when I'm upside down - M. Hedberg"
"Life is hard. After all, it kills you - K. Hepburn"
"A woman's mind is cleaner than a man's: She changes it more often - O. Herford"
"I love to go to Washington, if only to be near my money - B. Hope"
"Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive - E. Hubbard"
"Fashions have done more harm than revolutions - V. Hugo"
"There cannot be a crisis next week. My schedule is already full - H. A. Kissinger"
"Any girl can be glamorous. All you have to do is stand still and look stupid - H. Lamarr"
"I distrust camels, and anyone else who can go a week without a drink - J. E. Lewis"
"Every man's dream is to be able to sink into the arms of a woman without also falling into her hands - J. Lewis"
"I did not have three thousand pairs of shoes, I had one thousand and sixty - I. Marcos"
"Procrastination is the art of keeping up with yesterday - D. Marquis"
"A pessimist is a person who has had to listen to too many optimists - D. Marquis"
"A day without sunshine is like, you know, night - S. Martin"
"I want to make a jigsaw puzzle that's 40,000 pieces. And when you finish it, it says 'go outside.' - D. Martin"
"I refuse to join any club that would have me as a member - G. Marx"
"Anyone who says he can see through women is missing a lot - G. Marx"
"A child of five would understand this. Send someone to fetch a child of five - G. Marx"
"All people are born alike except Republicans and Democrats - G. Marx"
"Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else - M. Mead"
"Nobody ever went broke underestimating the taste of the American public - H. L. Mencken"
"Marriage is a wonderful institution, but who would want to live in an institution? - H. L. Mencken"
"My Father had a profound influence on me. He was a lunatic - S. Milligan"
"A sure cure for seasickness is to sit under a tree - S. Milligan"
"Because of their size, parents may be difficult to discipline properly - P. J. O'Rourke"
"Cleanliness becomes more important when godliness is unlikely - P. J. O'Rourke"
"Everybody knows how to raise children, except the people who have them - P. J. O'Rourke"
"Older people shouldn't eat health food, they need all the preservatives they can get - R. Orben"
"If two wrongs don't make a right, try three - L. J. Peter"
"A man doesn't know what he knows until he knows what he doesn't know - L. J. Peter"
"Originality is the fine art of remembering what you hear but forgetting where you heard it - L. J. Peter"
"How many people here have telekenetic powers? Raise my hand - E. Philips"
"Recession is when a neighbor loses his job. Depression is when you lose yours - R. Reagan"
"Before I refuse to take your questions, I have an opening statement - R. Reagan"
"One picture is worth 1,000 denials - R. Reagan"
"I knew I was an unwanted baby when I saw that my bath toys were a toaster and a radio - J. Rivers"
"I hate housework! You make the beds, you do the dishes and six months later you have to start all over again - J. Rivers"
"If God wanted us to bend over he'd put diamonds on the floor - J. Rivers"
"There are only three things women need in life: food, water, and compliments - C. Rock"
"Be thankful we're not getting all the government we're paying for - W. Rogers"
"I am not a member of any organized political party. I am a Democrat - W. Rogers"
"I'm not a real movie star. I've still got the same wife I started out with twenty eight years ago - W. Rogers"
"I never expected to see the day when girls would get sunburned in the places they now do - W. Rogers"
"I used to jog but the ice cubes kept falling out of my glass - D. L. Roth"
"When I eventually met Mr. Right I had no idea that his first name was Always - R. Rudner"
"I would never die for my beliefs because I might be wrong - B. Russell"
"The world is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper - B. Russell"
"My life needs editing - M. Sahl"
"I'm an idealist. I don't know where I'm going, but I'm on my way - C. Sandburg"
"I have a new philosophy. I'm only going to dread one day at a time - C. M. Schulz"
"I saw a woman wearing a sweatshirt with Guess on it. I said, Thyroid problem? - A. Schwarzenegger"
"It's simple, if it jiggles, it's fat - A. Schwarzenegger"
"It's amazing that the amount of news that happens in the world every day always just exactly fits the newspaper - J. Seinfeld"
"A government that robs Peter to pay Paul can always depend on the support of Paul - G. B. Shaw"
"If you can't get rid of the skeleton in your closet, you'd best teach it to dance - G. B. Shaw"
"Any kid will run any errand for you, if you ask at bedtime - R. Skelton"
"It takes considerable knowledge just to realize the extent of your own ignorance - T. Sowell"
"All right everyone, line up alphabetically according to your height - C. Stengel"
"What contemptible scoundrel has stolen the cork to my lunch? - W. C. Stone"
"I always wanted to be somebody, but now I realize I should have been more specific - L. Tomlin"
"If love is the answer, could you please rephrase the question? - L. Tomlin"
"A successful man is one who makes more money than his wife can spend. A successful woman is one who can find such a man - L. Turner"
"Go to Heaven for the climate, Hell for the company - M. Twain"
"Get your facts first, then you can distort them as you please - M. Twain"
"All generalizations are false, including this one - M. Twain"
"By trying we can easily endure adversity. Another man's, I mean - M. Twain"
"Money won't buy happiness, but it will pay the salaries of a large research staff to study the problem - B. Vaughan"
"The superfluous, a very necessary thing - Voltaire"
"When we talk to God, we're praying. When God talks to us, we're schizophrenic - J. Wagner"
"Every time I see an adult on a bicycle, I no longer despair for the future of the human race - H. G. Wells"
"Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before - M. West"
"I used to be Snow White, but I drifted - M. West"
"The next time you have a thought let it go - R. White"
"I no doubt deserved my enemies, but I don't believe I deserved my friends - W. Whitman"
"A lot of people are afraid of heights. Not me, I'm afraid of widths - S. Wright"
"I intend to live forever. So far, so good - S. Wright"
"I'm writing a book. I've got the page numbers done - S. Wright"
"I bought some batteries, but they weren't included - S. Wright"
"Cross country skiing is great if you live in a small country - S. Wright"
"If you're going to do something tonight that you'll be sorry for tomorrow morning, sleep late - H. Youngman"
"Power tends to corrupt and absolute power corrupts absolutely - L. Acton"
"In politics the middle way is none at all - J. Adams"
"He too serves a certain purpose who only stands and cheers - H. Adams"
"I must study politics and war that my sons may have liberty to study mathematics and philosophy - J. Adams"
"We hang the petty thieves and appoint the great ones to public office - Aesop"
"Confronted with the choice, the American people would choose the policeman's truncheon over the anarchist's bomb - S. T. Agnew"
"The darkest places in hell are reserved for those who maintain their neutrality in times of moral crisis - D. Alighieri"
"The secret of getting things done is to act! - D. Alighieri"
"Democracy is when the indigent, and not the men of property, are the rulers - Aristotle"
"Therefore, the good of man must be the end of the science of politics - Aristotle"
"Politics, it seems to me, for years, or all too long, has been concerned with right or left instead of right or wrong - R. Armour"
"So long as we have enough people in this country willing to fight for their rights, we'll be called a democracy - R. N. Baldwin"
"Vote for the man who promises least; he'll be the least disappointing - B. Baruch"
"There can be no wise politics without thought beforehand - A. Besant"
"Politics: A strife of interests masquerading as a contest of principles. The conduct of public affairs for private advantage - A. Bierce"
"Republicans have nothing but bad ideas and Democrats have no ideas - L. Black"
"He who knows how to flatter also knows how to slander - N. Bonaparte"
"In politics stupidity is not a handicap - N. Bonaparte"
"As you make your bed, so you must lie in it - D. J. Boorstin"
"If we desire respect for the law, we must first make the law respectable - L. D. Brandeis"
"The most important political office is that of the private citizen - L. D. Brandeis"
"You may think the president is all powerful, but he is not. He needs a lot of guidance from the Lord - B. Bush"
"Democracy is being allowed to vote for the candidate you dislike least - R. Byrne"
"I am not made for politics because I am incapable of wanting or accepting the death of the adversary - A. Camus"
"Republicans are men of narrow vision, who are afraid of the future - J. Carter"
"The revenues of Cuban state run companies are used exclusively for the benefit of the people, to whom they belong - F. Castro"
"The revolution is a dictatorship of the exploited against the exploiters - F. Castro"
"The world is governed by opinion - W. E. Channing"
"Television is democracy at its ugliest - P. Chayefsky"
"If we don't believe in freedom of expression for people we despise, we don't believe in it at all - N. Chomsky"
"If you have ten thousand regulations you destroy all respect for the law - W. Churchill"
"Healthy citizens are the greatest asset any country can have - W. Churchill"
"Politics is not a game. It is an earnest business - W. Churchill"
"In war, you can only be killed once, but in politics, many times - W. Churchill"
"Politics are very much like war. We may even have to use poison gas at times - W. Churchill"
"It is a fine game to play, the game of politics, and it is well worth waiting for a good hand before really plunging - W. Churchill"
"I have a fantasy where Ted Turner is elected President but refuses because he doesn't want to give up power - A. C. Clarke"
"Your every voter, as surely as your chief magistrate, exercises a public trust - G. Cleveland"
"People want change but not too much change. Finding that balance is tricky for every politician - E. Clift"
"In politics, what begins in fear usually ends in failure - S. T. Coleridge"
"Good government is good politics - R. J. Daley"
"The darkest places in hell are reserved for those who maintain their neutrality in times of moral crisis - D. Alighieri"
"When I was a boy I was told that anybody could become President; I'm beginning to believe it - C. Darrow"
"Their very conservatism is secondhand, and they don't know what they are conserving - R. Davies"
"In politics nothing is contemptible - B. Disraeli"
"Our party is a diverse one, as is my home state of Illinois - D. Durbin"
"It is our experience that political leaders do not always mean the opposite of what they say - A. Eban"
"Politics is for the present, but an equation is for eternity - A. Einstein"
"Oh, that lovely title, ex president - D. D. Eisenhower"
"Hell, I never vote for anybody, I always vote against - W. C. Fields"
"If you put the federal government in charge of the Sahara Desert, in 5 years there'd be a shortage of sand - M. Friedman"
"Only government can take perfectly good paper, cover it with perfectly good ink and make the combination worthless - M. Friedman"
"Hell hath no fury like a bureaucrat scorned - M. Friedman"
"The successful revolutionary is a statesman, the unsuccessful one a criminal - E. Fromm"
"Poetry is about the grief. Politics is about the grievance - R. Frost"
"In a democracy, dissent is an act of faith - J. W. Fulbright"
"The end move in politics is always to pick up a gun - R. B. Fuller"
"Politics is the art of choosing between the disastrous and the unpalatable - J. K. Galbraith"
"Liberalism is, I think, resurgent. One reason is that more and more people are so painfully aware of the alternative - J. K. Galbraith"
"When governments become large, voters cannot exercise close oversight, otherwise known as political power - M. Gallagher"
"It is better to be violent, if there is violence in our hearts, than to put on the cloak of nonviolence to cover impotence - M. Gandhi"
"Those who say religion has nothing to do with politics do not know what religion is - M. Gandhi"
"For every talent that poverty has stimulated it has blighted a hundred - J. W. Gardner"
"In order to become the master, the politician poses as the servant - C. de Gaulle"
"Politics is too serious a matter to be left to the politicians - C. de Gaulle"
"In politics it is necessary either to betray one's country or the electorate. I prefer to betray the electorate - C. de Gaulle"
"Life without liberty is like a body without spirit - K. Gibran"
"I always voted at my party's call, and I never thought of thinking for myself at all - W. Gilbert"
"Perseverance is the hard work you do after you get tired of doing the hard work you already did - N. Gingrich"
"Liberalism is trust of the people tempered by prudence. Conservatism is distrust of the people tempered by fear - W. E. Gladstone"
"An idea not coupled with action will never get any bigger than the brain cell it occupied - A. H. Glasow"
"A liberal is a man who is willing to spend somebody else's money - C. Glass"
"If voting changed anything, they'd make it illegal - E. Goldman"
"No real social change has ever been brought about without a revolution; revolution is but thought carried into action - E. Goldman"
"In most places in the country, voting is looked upon as a right and a duty, but in Chicago it's a sport - D. Gregory"
"We live in a world in which politics has replaced philosophy - M. L. Gross"
"Those who stand for nothing fall for anything - A. Hamilton"
"You cannot spend your way out of recession or borrow your way out of debt - D. Hannan"
"America's present need is not heroics but healing; not nostrums but normalcy; not revolution but restoration - W. G. Harding"
"I think there is one higher office than president and I would call that patriot - G. Hart"
"Voting is a civic sacrament - T. Hesburgh"
"What is politics but persuading the public to vote for this and support that and endure these for the promise of those? - G. Highet"
"The thing I enjoyed most were visits from children. They did not want public office - H. Hoover"
"We would all like to vote for the best man but he is never a candidate - K. Hubbard"
"Whenever a man has cast a longing eye on offices, a rottenness begins in his conduct - T. Jefferson"
"I have no ambition to govern men; it is a painful and thankless office - T. Jefferson"
"I never considered a difference of opinion in politics, in religion, in philosophy, as cause for withdrawing from a friend - T. Jefferson"
"Politics is such a torment that I advise everyone I love not to mix with it - T. Jefferson"
"Every politician should have been born an orphan and remain a bachelor - L. B. Johnson"
"It has been well said that a hungry man is more interested in four sandwiches than four freedoms - H. C. L. Jr."
"My brother Bob doesn't want to be in government, he promised Dad he'd go straight - J. F. Kennedy"
"Whenever men take the law into their own hands, the loser is the law. And when the law loses, freedom languishes - R. Kennedy"
"Frankly, I don't mind not being President. I just mind that someone else is - E. Kennedy"
"Politics is like football; if you see daylight, go through the hole - J. F. Kennedy"
"Ninety percent of the politicians give the other ten percent a bad reputation - H. A. Kissinger"
"The more I see of the representatives of the people, the more I admire my dogs - A. d. Lamartine"
"Instead of giving a politician the keys to the city, it might be better to change the locks - D. Larson"
"The public seldom forgive twice - J. K. Lavater"
"The only difference between the Democrats and the Republicans is that the Democrats allow the poor to be corrupt, too - O. Levant"
"Freedom of the press is guaranteed only to those who own one - A. J. Liebling"
"They say women talk too much. If you have worked in Congress you know that the filibuster was invented by men - C. B. Luce"
"Politics have no relation to morals - N. Machiavelli"
"When they see me holding fish, they can see that I am comfortable with kings as well as with paupers - I. Marcos"
"Our whole constitutional heritage rebels at the thought of giving government the power to control men's minds - T. Marshall"
"Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly and applying the wrong remedies - G. Marx"
"In this world of sin and sorrow there is always something to be thankful for; as for me, I rejoice that I am not a Republican - H. L. Mencken"
"Conservatives are not necessarily stupid, but most stupid people are conservatives - J. S. Mill"
"I can remember when Democrats believed that it was the duty of America to fight for freedom over tyranny - Z. Miller"
"You have not converted a man because you have silenced him - J. Morley"
"What politicians want to create is irreversible change because when you leave office someone changes it back again - E. Morris"
"Turn on to politics, or politics will turn on you - R. Nader"
"It is difficult to discern a serious threat to religious liberty from a room of silent, thoughtful schoolchildren - S. D. O'Connor"
"You better take advantage of the good cigars. You don't get much else in that job - T. P. O'Neill"
"When buying and selling are controlled by legislation, the first things to be bought and sold are legislators - P. J. O'Rourke"
"In the end, that's what this election is about. Do we participate in a politics of cynicism or a politics of hope? - B. Obama"
"Do you ever get the feeling that the only reason we have elections is to find out if the polls were right? - R. Orben"
"The activist is not the man who says the river is dirty. The activist is the man who cleans up the river - R. Perot"
"A healthy democracy requires a decent society; it requires that we are honorable, generous, tolerant and respectful - C. W. Pickering"
"A war for a great principle ennobles a nation - A. Pike"
"One of the penalties for refusing to participate in politics is that you end up being governed by your inferiors - Plato"
"I think it's a terrible shame that politics has become show business - S. Pollack"
"I do have a political agenda. It's to have as few regulations as possible - D. Quayle"
"A politician will do anything to keep his job, even become a patriot - W. Randolph"
"Inflation is as violent as a mugger, as frightening as an armed robber and as deadly as a hit man - R. Reagan"
"Politics is not a bad profession. If you succeed there are many rewards, if you disgrace yourself you can always write a book - R. Reagan"
"Politics is just like show business. You have a hell of an opening, coast for a while, and then have a hell of a close - R. Reagan"
"The largest party in America, by the way, is neither the Democrats nor the Republicans. It's the party of non voters - R. Reich"
"If you are going to sin, sin against God, not the bureaucracy. God will forgive you but the bureaucracy won't - H. Rickover"
"A fool and his money are soon elected - W. Rogers"
"I don't make jokes. I just watch the government and report the facts - W. Rogers"
"Politics has become so expensive that it takes a lot of money even to be defeated - W. Rogers"
"And after I make a lot of money, I'll be able to afford running for office - C. Romano"
"A conservative is a man with two perfectly good legs who, however, has never learned how to walk forward - F. D. Roosevelt"
"In politics, nothing happens by accident. If it happens, you can bet it was planned that way - F. D. Roosevelt"
"A typical vice of American politics is the avoidance of saying anything real on real issues - T. Roosevelt"
"The most practical kind of politics is the politics of decency - T. Roosevelt"
"A conservative is one who admires radicals centuries after they're dead - L. Rosten"
"I can't let important policy decisions hinge on the fact that an election is coming up every 90 days - G. Schroder"
"When the body of the people is possessed of the supreme power, it is called a democracy - C. d. Secondat"
"What Englishman will give his mind to politics as long as he can afford to keep a motor car? - G. B. Shaw"
"If nominated, I will not run; if elected, I will not serve - W. T. Sherman"
"Bad politicians are sent to Washington by good people who don't vote - W. E. Simon"
"The only security men can have for their political liberty, consists in keeping their money in their own pockets - L. Spooner"
"There ain't no answer. There ain't gonna be any answer. There never has been an answer. That's the answer - G. Stein"
"The first resistance to social change is to say it's not necessary - G. Steinem"
"A diplomat is a person who can tell you to go to hell in such a way that you actually look forward to the trip - C. Stinnett"
"I've been to war, and it's not easy to kill. It's bloody and messy and totally horrifying, and the consequences are serious - O. Stone"
"I am extraordinarily patient, provided I get my own way in the end - M. Thatcher"
"I am in politics because of the conflict between good and evil, and I believe that in the end good will triumph - M. Thatcher"
"One of the reasons people hate politics is that truth is rarely a politician's objective. Election and power are - C. Thomas"
"Politics is the art of controlling your environment - H. S. Thompson"
"There are many men of principle in both parties in America, but there is no party of principle - A. d. Tocqueville"
"A leader in the Democratic Party is a boss, in the Republican Party he is a leader - H. S. Truman"
"You want a friend in Washington? Get a dog - H. S. Truman"
"Principles have no real force except when one is well fed - M. Twain"
"We have, I fear, confused power with greatness - S. Udall"
"The Vice Presidency is sort of like the last cookie on the plate. Everybody insists he won't take it, but somebody always does - B. Vaughan"
"Any American who is prepared to run for president should automatically, by definition, be disqualified from ever doing so - G. Vidal"
"Half of the American people have never read a newspaper. Half never voted for President. One hopes it is the same half - G. Vidal"
"After much prayerful consideration, I feel that I must say I have climbed my last political mountain - G. C. Wallace"
"Democracy is the recurrent suspicion that more than half of the people are right more than half of the time - E. B. White"
"The flood of money that gushes into politics today is a pollution of democracy - T. White"
"Voters don't decide issues, they decide who will decide issues - G. Will"
"Conservatives define themselves in terms of what they oppose - G. Will"
"A conservative is someone who makes no changes and consults his grandmother when in doubt - W. Wilson"
"A conservative is a man who just sits and thinks, mostly sits - W. Wilson"
"Politics is war without bloodshed while war is politics with bloodshed - M. Zedong"
"Life is wasted on the living - D. Adams"
"The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions - A. Adler"
"Life is a dream for the wise, a game for the fool, a comedy for the rich, a tragedy for the poor - S. Aleichem"
"A man sooner or later discovers that he is the master gardener of his soul, the director of his life - J. Allen"
"Seventy percent of success in life is showing up - W. Allen"
"Life loves the liver of it - M. Angelou"
"Life is pleasant. Death is peaceful. It's the transition that's troublesome - I. Asimov"
"Our life is what our thoughts make it - M. Aurelius"
"The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing - M. Aurelius"
"Here is the test to find whether your mission on Earth is finished: if you're alive, it isn't - R. Bach"
"The hope is a perfect breakfast but a bitter dinner - F. Bacon"
"Life is a long lesson in humility - J. M. Barrie"
"Time is like a snowflake, disappears while we are deciding what to do with it", "- R. Battaglia"
"Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay - S. d. Beauvoir"
"Life is 10 percent what you make it, and 90 percent how you take it - I. Berlin"
"Life consists not in holding good cards but in playing those you hold well - J. Billings"
"Life appears to me too short to be spent in nursing animosity, or registering wrongs - C. Bronte"
"To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as one's own in the midst of abundance - Buddha"
"Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment - Buddha"
"Most people have never learned that one of the main aims in life is to enjoy it - S. Butler"
"Life is not an exact science, it is an art - S. Butler"
"Don't go through life, grow through life - E. Butterworth"
"Remember never to confuse kindness and availability with weakness - C. Butturini"
"The purpose of life is a life of purpose - R. Byrne"
"We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us - J. Campbell"
"The privilege of a lifetime is being who you are - J. Campbell"
"I don't believe people are looking for the meaning of life as much as they are looking for the experience of being alive - J. Campbell"
"Life is a tragedy when seen in close up, but a comedy in long shot - C. Chaplin"
"How can you be alive and happy if there in the world people who can't? - Che Guevara"
"Any idiot can face a crisis, it's day to day living that wears you out - A. Chekhov"
"The true object of all human life is play. Earth is a task garden; heaven is a playground - G. K. Chesterton"
"While there's life, there's hope - M. T. Cicero"
"What a wonderful life I've had! I only wish I'd realized it sooner - S. G. Colette"
"Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated - Confucius"
"There are three constants in life: change, choice and principles - S. Covey"
"Unbeing dead isn't being alive - e. e. cummings"
"Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less - M. Curie"
"A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life - C. Darwin"
"Often we are able of seeing an opportunity only after someone has picked it up - E. De Bono"
"To live is so startling it leaves little time for anything else - E. Dickinson"
"What we think determines what happens to us, so if we want to change our lives, we need to stretch our minds - W. Dyer"
"Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life - W. Dyer"
"Only a life lived for others is a life worthwhile - A. Einstein"
"All the art of living lies in a fine mingling of letting go and holding on - H. Ellis"
"All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better - R. W. Emerson"
"It is not length of life, but depth of life - R. W. Emerson"
"The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall - R. W. Emerson"
"With the past, I have nothing to do; nor with the future. I live now - R. W. Emerson"
"Life consists in what a man is thinking of all day - R. W. Emerson"
"The truth is you don't know what is going to happen tomorrow. Life is a crazy ride, and nothing is guaranteed - Eminem"
"The greatest pleasure of life is love - Euripides"
"There is just one life for each of us: our own - Euripides"
"Don't let life discourage you; everyone who got where he is had to begin where he was - R. L. Evans"
"One way to get the most out of life is to look upon it as an adventure - W. Feather"
"We must be willing to let go of the life we have planned, so as to have the life that is waiting for us - E. M. Forster"
"The main facts in human life are five: birth, food, sleep, love and death - E. M. Forster"
"In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on - R. Frost"
"A person will sometimes devote all his life to the development of one part of his body the wishbone - R. Frost"
"Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever - M. Gandhi"
"My life is my message - M. Gandhi"
"Life is a series of collisions with the future; it is not the sum of what we have been, but what we yearn to be - J. O. y. Gasset"
"Everything you can imagine doing, or can dream of, do it now. Audacity has genius and magic - J. W. Goethe"
"I love those who yearn for the impossible - J. W. v. Goethe"
"What is important in life is life, and not the result of life - J. W. v. Goethe"
"It's all about quality of life and finding a happy balance between work and friends and family - P. Green"
"You're only here for a short visit. Don't hurry, don't worry. And be sure to smell the flowers along the way - W. Hagen"
"The only disability in life is a bad attitude - S. Hamilton"
"When I hear somebody sigh, 'Life is hard,' I am always tempted to ask, 'Compared to what?' - S. J. Harris"
"The art of life is to know how to enjoy a little and to endure very much - W. Hazlitt"
"The story of life is quicker then the blink of an eye, the story of love is hello, goodbye - J. Hendrix"
"The most important thing is to enjoy your life, to be happy, it's all that matters - A. Hepburn"
"Life is half spent before we know what it is - G. Herbert"
"We can't plan life. All we can do is be available for it - L. Hill"
"Life is ten percent what happens to you and ninety percent how you respond to it - L. Holtz"
"I love life because what more is there? - A. Hopkins"
"Remember when life's path is steep to keep your mind even - Horace"
"Life is largely a matter of expectation - Horace"
"Fortunately analysis is not the only way to resolve inner conflicts. Life itself still remains a very effective therapist - K. Horney"
"You have succeeded in life when all you really want is only what you really need - V. Howard"
"Life in abundance comes only through great love - E. Hubbard"
"A healthful hunger for a great idea is the beauty and blessedness of life - J. Ingelow"
"Believe that life is worth living and your belief will help create the fact - W. James"
"The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes - W. James"
"The great use of life is to spend it for something that will outlast it - W. James"
"To change ones life: Start immediately. Do it flamboyantly - W. James"
"This life is worth living, we can say, since it is what we make it - W. James"
"A chain is no stronger than its weakest link, and life is after all a chain - W. James"
"The shoe that fits one person pinches another; there is no recipe for living that suits all cases - C. Jung"
"Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood - H. Keller"
"Change is the law of life. And those who look only to the past or present are certain to miss the future - J. F. Kennedy"
"Once you say you're going to settle for second, that's what happens to you in life - J. F. Kennedy"
"Life isn't a matter of milestones, but of moments - R. Kennedy"
"Life is a succession of moments, to live each one is to succeed - C. Kent"
"Our life always expresses the result of our dominant thoughts - S. Kierkegaard"
"Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced - S. Kierkegaard"
"I do not regret one moment of my life - L. Langtry"
"Life is something to do when you can't get to sleep - F. Lebowitz"
"If you love life, don't waste time, for time is what life is made up of - B. Lee"
"Life is too short to work so hard - V. Leigh"
"Life is what happens while you are busy making other plans - J. Lennon"
"The most busy life is the most happy - G. Leopardi"
"Virtue does not shine in an unadorned robe - G. Leopardi"
"The most exhausting thing in life is being insincere - A. M. Lindbergh"
"I have a simple philosophy: Fill what's empty. Empty what's full. Scratch where it itches - A. R. Longworth"
"Open your eyes, look within. Are you satisfied with the life you're living? - B. Marley"
"For the happiest life, days should be rigorously planned, nights left open to chance - M. McLaughlin"
"The aim of life is to live, and to live means to be aware, joyously, drunkenly, serenely, divinely aware - H. Miller"
"Maybe all one can do is hope to end up with the right regrets - A. Miller"
"Who is able to listen not only is pleasing to everyone, but after a while he even ends up learning something - W. Mizner"
"The true secret of happiness lies in taking a genuine interest in all the details of daily life - W. Morris"
"I look back on my life like a good day's work, it was done and I am satisfied with it - G. Moses"
"Life is what we make it, always has been, always will be - G. Moses"
"To live is to change, and to be perfect is to have changed often - J. H. Newman"
"He who has a why to live can bear almost any how - F. Nietzsche"
"People living deeply have no fear of death - A. Nin"
"We are here to add what we can to life, not to get what we can from life - W. Osler"
"Life's a fight. It's a good fight of faith - J. Osteen"
"Life must be lived as play - Plato"
"A life is not important except in the impact it has on other lives - J. Robinson"
"We are all here for a spell, get all the good laughs you can - W. Rogers"
"If life were predictable it would cease to be life, and be without flavor - E. Roosevelt"
"I have found that if you love life, life will love you back - A. Rubinstein"
"There is no wealth but life - J. Ruskin"
"The good life is one inspired by love and guided by knowledge - B. Russell"
"A baby is God's opinion that life should go on - C. Sandburg"
"Nearly all the best things that came to me in life have been unexpected, unplanned by me - C. Sandburg"
"Everything has been figured out, except how to live - J. Sartre"
"I think I've discovered the secret of life, you just hang around until you get used to it - C. M. Schulz"
"Life becomes harder for us when we live for others, but it also becomes richer and happier - A. Schweitzer"
"Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life - Seneca"
"While we are postponing, life speeds by - L. A. Seneca"
"Life's like a play: it's not the length, but the excellence of the acting that matters - L. A. Seneca"
"A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing - G. B. Shaw"
"Life does not cease to be funny when people die any more than it ceases to be serious when people laugh - G. B. Shaw"
"Kindness, I've discovered, is everything in life - I. B. Singer"
"Life will always be to a large extent what we ourselves make it - S. Smiles"
"Beware the barrenness of a busy life - Socrates"
"Not life, but good life, is to be chiefly valued - Socrates"
"The indispensable first step to getting the things you want out of life is this: decide what you want - B. Stein"
"I take a simple view of life. It is keep your eyes open and get on with it - L. Sterne"
"An aim in life is the only fortune worth finding - R. L. Stevenson"
"There is only one difference between a long life and a good dinner: that, in the dinner, the sweets come last - R. L. Stevenson"
"Our business in life is not to succeed, but to continue to fail in good spirits - R. L. Stevenson"
"May you live all the days of your life - J. Swift"
"I slept and dreamt that life was joy. I awoke and saw that life was service. I acted and behold, service was joy - R. Tagore"
"We live in the world when we love it - R. Tagore"
"The price of anything is the amount of life you exchange for it - H. D. Thoreau"
"To affect the quality of the day, that is the highest of arts - H. D. Thoreau"
"To think of knowing is like looking at the sea believing it ends at the horizon - L. Tiburzi"
"True life is lived when tiny changes occur - L. Tolstoy"
"Everything in life is luck - D. Trump"
"Don't go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first - M. Twain"
"Good friends, good books and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life - M. Twain"
"When we remember we are all mad, the mysteries disappear and life stands explained - M. Twain"
"A well spent day brings happy sleep - L. da Vinci"
"Life well spent is long - L. da Vinci"
"Every man dies. Not every man really lives - W. Wallace"
"Life is never easy for those who dream - R. J. Waller"
"You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough - M. West"
"To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all - O. Wilde"
"A grapefruit is a lemon who had an opportunity and seized it - O. Wilde"
"Sometimes it is better to be silent and looks stupid rather then talking, taking off every doubt - O. Wilde"
"Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about - O. Wilde"
"Give me the luxuries of life and I will willingly do without the necessities - F. L. Wright"
"Our ideals are our better selves - A. B. Alcott"
"I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.' - M. Ali"
"Ad augusta per angusta - Anonymous"
"Let each man exercise the art he knows - Aristophanes"
"We are what we do daily, so excellence is not in a single act but in the behavior - Aristotle"
"Hope is a waking dream - Aristotle"
"Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can - A. Ashe"
"Look within. Within is the fountain of good, and it will ever bubble up, if thou wilt ever dig - M. Aurelius"
"You are always free to change your mind and choose a different future, or a different past - R. Bach"
"Monuments to intelligence survive to monuments to power - F. Bacon"
"Give light and people will find the way - E. Baker"
"Enthusiasm moves the world - A. Balfour"
"Tears of joy are like the summer rain drops pierced by sunbeams - H. Ballou"
"It is always the simple that produces the marvelous - A. Barr"
"It is only in sorrow bad weather masters us; in joy we face the storm and defy it - A. Barr"
"I do love to eavesdrop. It's inspirational, not only for subject matter but for actual dialogue, the way people talk - L. Barry"
"Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul - H. W. Beecher"
"If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door - M. Berle"
"The authentic self is the soul made visible - S. B. Breathnach"
"Happiness is the natural flower of duty - P. Brooks"
"Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship - Buddha"
"When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go - C. Burnett"
"Veni, vidi, vici - Caesar"
"Alea iacta est - Caesar"
"Find a place inside where there's joy, and the joy will burn out the pain - J. Campbell"
"Follow your bliss and the universe will open doors where there were only walls - J. Campbell"
"Men must live and create. Live to the point of tears - A. Camus"
"Who fights can lose, who doesn't already has - Che Guevara"
"Backward? Not even to take a run! - Che Guevara"
"Everything that deserves being done, deserves being done well - P. D. S. Chesterfield"
"Without education we incur in the risk of taking seriously all educated people - G. K. Chesterton"
"The courage is the first of human qualities, because it makes all the others possible - W. Churchill"
"A pessimist sees difficulty in every opportunity; an optimist sees opportunity in every difficulty - W. Churchill"
"Only one thing makes a dream impossible. The fear of failing - P. Coelho"
"Try to be like the turtle, at ease in your own shell - B. Copeland"
"My tastes and inspirational artists were always rather eclectic and diverse - T. Dayne"
"I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination - J. Dean"
"Happiness resides not in possessions, and not in gold, happiness dwells in the soul - Democritus"
"Think with your whole body - T. Deshimaru"
"Space is an inspirational concept that allows you to dream big - P. Diamandis"
"Teachers need to be more inspirational. But it's also up to engineering to make itself more interesting - B. Dickinson"
"You have to make it happen - D. Diderot"
"I am prepared for the worst, but hope for the best - B. Disraeli"
"If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves - T. A. Edison"
"Imagination is more important than knowledge - A. Einstein"
"It is never too late to be what you might have been - G. Eliot"
"God always gives His best to those who leave the choice with him - J. Elliot"
"Give light, and the darkness will disappear of itself - D. Erasmus"
"It is easy to be courageous at safety distance - Esopo"
"To meet each other is a beginning, to remain together is a progress, to work together is a success - H. Ford"
"It is by acts and not by ideas that people live - A. France"
"Whoever is happy will make others happy too - A. Frank"
"How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world - A. Frank"
"A place for everything, everything in its place - B. Franklin"
"The best way out is always through - R. Frost"
"If it were not for hopes, the heart would break - T. Fuller"
"In a gentle way, you can shake the world - M. Gandhi"
"Be faithful to that which exists within yourself - A. Gide"
"It is not strong the one who never falls, but the one who falling manage to rise again - J. W. Goethe"
"Happy and great is only the one who, to be someone, needs neither to dictate nor to obey - J. W. Goethe"
"Love and desire are the spirit's wings to great deeds - J. W. v. Goethe"
"I arise full of eagerness and energy, knowing well what achievement lies ahead of me - Z. Grey"
"Thought is the wind, knowledge the sail, and mankind the vessel - A. Hare"
"We relish news of our heroes, forgetting that we are extraordinary to somebody too - H. Hayes"
"Wonder rather than doubt is the root of all knowledge - A. J. Heschel"
"Cherish your visions and your dreams as they are the children of your soul, the blueprints of your ultimate achievements - N. Hill"
"Belief creates the actual fact - W. James"
"The glow of one warm thought is to me worth more than money - T. Jefferson"
"Who aims at being great, be the servant of everyone - Jesus"
"Everyone here has the sense that right now is one of those moments when we are influencing the future - S. Jobs"
"A very few things are impossible if you are diligent and capable. Big things are done not with strength but with perseverance - S. Johnson"
"If you accept the expectations of others, especially negative ones, then you never will change the outcome - M. Jordan"
"The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched, they must be felt with the heart - H. Keller"
"I am very conscious of who I am as an artist and as an inspirational person - R. Kelly"
"Many people see how things are and say: why? I see how things could be and say: why not? - R. Kennedy"
"Ideas shape the course of history - J. M. Keynes"
"I view art as an inspirational tool - T. Kincade"
"I do not fear the violents' words, rather the honests' silence - M. L. King"
"It is not ignorance but knowledge which is the mother of wonder - J. W. Krutch"
"If the world seems cold to you, kindle fires to warm it - L. Larcom"
"A limited brain contains and unlimited quantity of stupid things - S. Lec"
"You change your life by changing your heart - M. Lucado"
"Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree - M. Luther"
"Every moment and every event of every man's life on earth plants something in his soul - T. Merton"
"A pencil and a dream can take you anywhere - J. Meyer"
"As knowledge increases, wonder deepens - C. Morgan"
"Act like you expect to get into the end zone - C. Morley"
"That which does not kill us makes us stronger - F. Nietzsche"
"It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light - A. Onassis"
"We have it in our power to begin the world over again - T. Paine"
"Noble deeds that are concealed are most esteemed - B. Pascal"
"The best way to have a good idea is to have lots of ideas - L. Pauling"
"Change your thoughts and you change your world - N. V. Peale"
"Sport is something that is very inspirational for young people - Pele"
"Thinking: the talking of the soul with itself - Plato"
"What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality - Plutarch"
"I have looked into your eyes with my eyes. I have put my heart near your heart - Pope John XXIII"
"Hope is but the dream of those who wake - M. Prior"
"When deeds speak, words are nothing - P. Proudhon"
"My mind's my kingdom - F. Quarles"
"Your present circumstances don't determine where you can go; they merely determine where you start - N. Qubein"
"We can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone - R. Reagan"
"It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped - T. Robbins"
"We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish - T. Robbins"
"Only those who have learned the power of sincere and selfless contribution experience life's deepest joy: true fulfillment - T. Robbins"
"Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present - J. Rohn"
"The future is in the hands of the people who believe in their dreams - E. Roosevelt"
"Believe you can and you're halfway there - T. Roosevelt"
"You must do the things you think you cannot do - E. Roosevelt"
"With self discipline anything is possible - T. Roosevelt"
"When the sun is shining I can do anything; no mountain is too high, no trouble too difficult to overcome - W. Rudolph"
"Don't let the fear of striking out hold you back - B. Ruth"
"A sunray can delete millions of shadows - S. Francesco"
"Mankind is made great or little by its own will - F. Schiller"
"What great thing would you attempt if you knew you could not fail? - R. H. Schuller"
"I am so fresh in soul and spirit that life gushes and bubbles around me in a thousand springs - R. Schumann"
"Books are challenging and inspirational to me - A. Sedaris"
"Per aspera ad astra - Seneca"
"Don't wait for the right moment, make it! - G. B. Shaw"
"If you don't have a big heart you'll not succeed - L. K. Shing"
"I have amazing friends who have led inspirational lives - A. Shue"
"Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success - S. Sivananda"
"It's inspirational to see someone who is dying smile - A. Specter"
"Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant - R. L. Stevenson"
"There is nothing stronger in the world than gentleness - H. Suyin"
"Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky - R. Tagore"
"Want to be happy for a moment? Avenge. Want to be happy forever? Forgive - Tertulliano"
"I have never allowed school to interfere with my education - M. Twain"
"You have to believe in yourself - S. Tzu"
"Create each day anew - M. Ueshiba"
"Half of the beauty depends on the landscape, the other half on the man who looks at it - L. Ultang"
"I wanted to do something inspirational for my children - H. Weinstein"
"Sad is that disciple who does not advance his master - L. da Vinci"
"There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it - E. Wharton"
"Better to be called something positive and inspirational than something negative - D. Yen"
"God sleeps in the minerals, awakens in plants, walks in animals, and thinks in man - A. Young"
"Deacon Jones has been the most inspirational person in my football career - J. Youngblood"
